Datatable.LocalizationPair: System Improvement [industryColored] cost on Systems orbited by Behemoth
+50 [industryColored] on Colonized Planets with Anomalies on System
+10 [industryColored] on Colonized Planets with Anomalies on System
+20 [scienceColored] on Colonized Planets with Anomalies on System
This collection focuses on war-time science.
This collection focuses on ground combat.
This collection bonuses on manpower and influence.
Improvements are 35% less likely to be destroyed during Invasions
The Bhagaba introduce methods that coincidentally seem to help with spreading the envy of your delicious and unique food.
A history of Endless genetic alteration for Dust sensitivity allows the dredging of Dust even on the most lush and verdant planets.
Fervent belief in the mission of Isyander and the Lost increases contributions to the Academy by 20%
No [fids] penalty on Temples of the Lost
Superior logistics allow you to quickly organize the deployment of heroes. While the heroes may not appreciate your efficiency, their flexibility is truly something to be envied.
This population focuses on Money and Ground Combat

Nakalim Ground Battle Offense Strategy Unlocked: Precision A2G Strikes (improved "Preemptive Bombing" that allows for deploying additional troops and additional bombardment damage) Nakalim Ground Battle Offense Strategy Unlocked: Manipular Formation Tactics (improved "Guerilla" with better troop health and a lower troop damage penalty)
Long experience with orbital bombardment allows for more precise placement of munitions, causing greater damage to the enemy without risking shelling your own troops.
Ancient arts of ground warfare refined over the long height of your empire allows for the engagement of any type of enemy in any terrain without significant losses.

Many spatio-temporal anomalies are not mere examples of statistical happenstance, but are consequences of prior habitation by the Lost, during their heyday. Frequently; they even exhibit fleeting remnants of primordial dust, and thus, latent fragments of the consciousness of the Lost who touched these sites. As much of the Nakalim's native "technology" interfaces directly with the Lost and their dust, these sites can trigger surprising activations and 'echoes' inside any artifacts of that era - all of which is a wealth of opportunity for knowledge about the subject.

Founded by the late King Kamdir, these schools train the local populace in self defense and raise up the best among them to become the Temple Guard. Following years of training and an intense ritual exposure to the contents of certain Relics, the Temple Guard no longer require speech to communicate with their comrades, and are finally allowed to protect the Relics, the Temples, and their worshipers.
+10% Defending troops health per Temple on System
+25 [prestigeColored] per Planet without Temple on System
+10 [growthcolored] on System +10 [industrycolored] on System -15% System Improvement [industrycolored] Cost on System

Boarding Pods reduce [manPower] of enemy Ships every second. The enemy Ship is captured if a Boarding Pod is active and the Ship reaches 0 [manPower]. Manpower damage is impacted by relative Infantry strength, so Infantry upgrades will affect your damage. Boarding Pods will not target Hero Ships, Arks, Academy Ships, or Behemoths. Boarding Pods will not consume manpower from the source ship.

This module, specially made for the Academy and by the Academy, is dedicated to wasting as much space as possible and making your soldiers have a terrible time in their bunkers. This is so effective in fact, that the number of crew that can be stationed in this ship is vastly decreased.
How many types of luxury resources will be placed onto planets.
Spawns 4 common luxuries, 2 uncommon, and 2 rare. Automatically reveals 2 types of luxuries. (Recommended for Tiny galaxy size)
Spawns 6 common luxuries, 3 uncommon, and 3 rare. Automatically reveals 5 types of luxuries. (Recommended for Small galaxy size)
Spawns 8 common luxuries, 4 uncommon, and 4 rare. Automatically reveals 8 types of luxuries. (Recommended for Normal galaxy size and higher)
Spawns 8 common luxuries, 8 uncommon, and 8 rare. Automatically reveals 10 types of luxuries. #FF0000#May cause world generation errors, be careful.#REVERT#
The animations will be played 8 times faster.
The animations will be played 16 times faster.
The animations will be played 32 times faster.
The animations will be played 16 times faster. #6F737A#"I have a feeling that when I turn that on I'll never be able to turn it off" - ANGRYABOUTELVES#REVERT#
Ideal quantity of Minor Civilizations per Player in the Systems you explore
No minor factions will be generated #FF0000#Will break certain faction quests and render some faction's traits useless#REVERT#
The game will try to generate 1 minor factions per player.
The game will try to generate 2 minor factions per player.
The game will try to generate 3 minor factions per player.
The game will try to generate 4 minor factions per player. (Recommended)
The game will try to generate 5 minor factions per player.
The game will try to generate 6 minor factions per player.
The game will try to generate 7 minor factions per player.
The game will try to generate 8 minor factions per player.
Disables Hacking choices that directly interfere with other players.
Disables the Academy being able to expand on its own, the Nakalim may still donate to it.
Ideal quantity of non faction-specific Unique Planets to be placed into the galaxy
No non faction-specific Unique planets will be placed into the galaxy.
1 non faction-specific Unique planets will be placed into the galaxy. (Recommended for Tiny size galaxies)
2 non faction-specific Unique planets will be placed into the galaxy. (Recommended for Small size galaxies)
3 non faction-specific Unique planets will be placed into the galaxy. (Recommended for Normal size galaxies)
4 non faction-specific Unique planets will be placed into the galaxy. (Recommended for Large size galaxies)
5 non faction-specific Unique planets will be placed into the galaxy. (Recommended for Huge size galaxies)
6 non faction-specific Unique planets will be placed into the galaxy. (Recommended for Colossal size galaxies)
7 non faction-specific Unique planets will be placed into the galaxy. (Recommended for Gigantic size galaxies)
8 non faction-specific Unique planets will be placed into the galaxy.

Enabling this will give AI empires their random personalities without any restrictions, allowing you to find things such as Mercantile Pacifist Cravers who just wants to be buds with you as he expands his merchant fleet, or a Cruel Militarist Unfallen who wants to use his vines to spread death across the galaxy.
Enabling this will allow you to terraform unique planets. Disabling this will make it just like vanilla.
You will be able to terraform unique planets.
You will not be able to terraform unique planets.
Enabling this will allow you to terraform planets to and from Sterile and Fertile.
You will be able to terraform planets to and from Sterile and Fertile.
You will only be able to use vanilla terraformation.
Every system will have more than their share of curiosities.
Every system will have a large amount of curiosities.
Ideally every planet will have an anomaly, but we know the gods of RNG will not allow that.
Every planet will have ~3 anomalies, but some might be selfish and have more.
Determines the quantity of unique anomalies that will spawn. These are very powerful, so be wary.
No unique anomalies will spawn. (Not recommended)
1 unique anomaly will spawn. (Recommended for Tiny size galaxies)
2 unique anomalies will spawn. (Recommended for Small size galaxies)
3 unique anomalies will spawn. (Recommended for Normal size galaxies)
4 unique anomalies will spawn. (Recommended for Large size galaxies)
5 unique anomalies will spawn. (Recommended for Large or Huge size Galaxies)
6 unique anomalies will spawn. (Recommended for Huge size galaxies)
7 unique anomalies will spawn. (Recommended for Colossal size galaxies)
8 unique anomalies will spawn. (Recommended for Gigantic size galaxies)

Leave this at 1 if you don't care. You can use this to adjust for having not enough players in a large map by increasing the multiplier, or by lowering it to below 1 to compensate for having too many players in a small map. All this does is increase/decrease colonization limit and multiply the number of minor factions that spawn.
You will have a 1/4x as big overcolonization limit and 1/4x as many minor factions will spawn.
You will have a 1/2x as big overcolonization limit and 1/2x as many minor factions will spawn.
You will have a 3/4x as big overcolonization limit and 3/4x as many minor factions will spawn.
You will have the standard overcolonization limit and the set number of minor factions will spawn.
You will have a 3/2x as big overcolonization limit and 3/2x as many minor factions will spawn.
You will have a 2x as big overcolonization limit and 2x as many minor factions will spawn.
You will have a 5/2x as big overcolonization limit and 5/2x as many minor factions will spawn.
You will have a 3x as big overcolonization limit and 3x as many minor factions will spawn.
You will have a 7/2x as big overcolonization limit and 7/2x as many minor factions will spawn.
You will have a 4x as big overcolonization limit and 4x as many minor factions will spawn.
You will have a 9/2x as big overcolonization limit and 9/2x as many minor factions will spawn.
You will have a 5x as big overcolonization limit and 5x as many minor factions will spawn.
Determines the quantity of anomalies that will spawn. 1/3 of anomalies will need to be probed first, as in vanilla.
60 anomalies will spawn. (Recommended for Tiny map size)
80 anomalies will spawn. (Recommended for Small map size)
100 anomalies will spawn. (Recommended for Normal map size)
120 anomalies will spawn. (Recommended for Large map size)
150 anomalies will spawn. (Recommended for Huge map size)
180 anomalies will spawn. (Recommended for Colossal map size)
200 anomalies will spawn. (Recommended for Gigantic map size)

Determines the quantity of curiosities that will spawn. Different types will spawn as following: Luxuries (11%), Strategics (22%), and Loot (67%). Quest Curiosities will be listed in the description, but 4 are guaranteed to spawn separately, per player.
50 curiosities will spawn, with 6 additional being quest anomalies. (Recommended for Tiny map size)
100 curiosities will spawn, with 7 additional being quest anomalies. (Recommended for Small map size)
150 anomalies will spawn, with 8 additional being quest anomalies. (Recommended for Normal map size)
200 anomalies will spawn, with 9 additional being quest anomalies. (Recommended for Large map size)
250 anomalies will spawn, with 10 additional being quest anomalies. (Recommended for Huge map size)
300 anomalies will spawn, with 11 additional being quest anomalies. (Recommended for Colossal map size)
350 anomalies will spawn, with 12 additional being quest anomalies. (Recommended for Gigantic map size)
400 anomalies will spawn, with 13 additional being quest anomalies.
450 anomalies will spawn, with 14 additional being quest anomalies.
500 anomalies will spawn, with 15 additional being quest anomalies.
With access to both ancient and recent studies and data, the Librarian can find answers to difficult questions, discover advanced technologies, and highly effectively infiltrate networks.

The Librarian can access hidden information only available to the Academy, such as data on the state of heroes and other empires, critical hacking vulnerabilities in network protocols, and a cache of scientific information enabling the research of technologies one stage higher than normal.

The Master of Dust holds the keys to the Academy's vaults--within limits, of course--and can use this wealth to affect diplomatic actions. The Master of Dust also gains the Academy's support when dealing in trade and diplomacy, allowing free trade deals and the imposing of peaceful relations on otherwise intractable empires.

The Master of Dust can make grants with the Academy's funds, and has access to the Academy's extensive business communications network and contacts making all trade deals effectively free and enabling them to force peaceful relations.
I expected fleets of ships, not an offer of peace. I will not hide the Aurigans' feeling of relief.

The construction of nano-machines--or nanites--capable of operating in liquid environments with various conditions of salinity, temperature, pressure, and microbial life has a range of potential applications. Research into energy sources, locomotion, and self-repair enables a whole ecology of these liquid nanites to be developed.

The construction of Church approved nano-machines--or nanites--capable of operating in liquid environments with various conditions of salinity, temperature, pressure, and microbial life has a range of potential applications. Research into energy sources, locomotion, and self-repair enables a whole ecology of these liquid nanites to be developed.
Mining Probes can collect FIDS resources of a planet and add them to the Home System's resource generation.
Garrison the fleet and dock it into the hangar of the current start system to quickly repair and restock. You may only garrison your own star system.
To increase Militarist Political ideology: build ships, defense, be aggressive with other factions.

A tendency of hiding from conflict means you can't initiate war unless there are Militarists within the Leading Political Parties.
Mutually assured promises of "easy money" and "free science" actually come true, resulting in everyone literally just getting free money.
All Trade Agreements have free Upkeep, Proposal, and Cancellation costs.
With a more stable senate, you are able to represent more parties
Add 1 slot to political party representation on Senate (Maximum 3) Doesn't affect dictatorships
Your senators are actually doing their job for once, and this allows you to squeeze in more legislation before they all go on holiday.
Eww yucky we hate the cold.
I don't like sand. It's course, and rough, and irritating. And it gets everywhere.
Oh jeez oh man, could you imagine living on a rock? That sounds scary.

This society has spent much of its time making sure the bureaucratic process runs as smoothly as possible, allowing this Empire to manage more colonies before running into problems.

This empire's people never cared about the finer details and paperwork, always thinking someone else would handle it. As a result, it cant manage as many colonies as others before things grind to a halt.

The Academy has hidden certain design specifications of their ships from other factions, even going as far as to scramble ship scans in certain cases. Rest assured that the military power estimate is correct.

Food production increases population Normal Consumption Formula: (Population Using Food + (Population Using Double Food * 2)) / (300 * Game Speed Modifier) Vodyani Consumption Formula: ((System Food ^ 1.25) / 1200 / Game Speed Modifier * 2) - 1% per Vodyani Population Horatio population consume twice as much food

Food production increases population Normal Consumption Formula: (Population Using Food + (Population Using Double Food * 2)) / (300 * Game Speed Modifier) Vodyani Consumption Formula: ((System Food ^ 1.25) / 1200 / Game Speed Modifier * 2) - 1% per Vodyani Population Horatio population consume twice as much food
Industry is used to build Improvements and Ships on this System. Industry not used the turn it is produced, gets saved for one turn, and added onto the next turn.

Putting a unit of Population in this slot will create Overpopulation penalties for the System Approval. Disapproval Formula = (Overpopulation Threshold - (Maximum Population * Percentage of Overpopulated Population)) * 3.75

Putting units of Population in these slots will create Overpopulation penalties for the System Approval. Disapproval Formula = (Overpopulation Threshold - (Maximum Population * Percentage of Overpopulated Population)) * 3.75

Influence increases Influence zones around the system, and is the currency for Diplomacy. Influence Radius Formula = ((System Influence / Game Speed Multiplier) / [pi])^0.4 / (1.5 + (50 / System Influence))
Influence increases Influence zones around the system, and is the currency for Diplomacy. Law Initial Cost is whichever is higher = Law Level * 5 OR 60% of your total influence
Influence increases Influence zones around systems, and is the currency for Diplomacy.

Science is used by the empire to research new technologies. Tech Cost Formula = (((1 + (Total Techs Researched * 3)^1.05 - Total Techs Researched + 15) * 2)^1.25 * Era Multiplier Era Multipliers = 1.25, 2, 7.5, 20, 50, 50

Lists active Trading Companies and Trade Routes Base Trade HQ Income = 250 * (4.2) ^ Number of Trading Locations * (0.75 + Trading Company Level / 35 ^ 0.75) * Trade Value (For Luxury resources, multiply by (abundance * 0.025)) Luxury Resource Income from a subsidiary is reduced by 20% (or 40% if both trading locations are subsidiaries) Total population, abundance and rarity of Luxuries, distance between trade locations are the most important factors for determining Trade Value. Some System Development Upgrades and System Improvements can vastly improve Trade Value. Putting a HQ or Subsidiary adjacent to another HQ or Subsidiary reduces your luxury resource income by 40% Trading with an ally reduces luxury resource trade income by 10%, Trading with someone you are at peace with reduces luxury income by 40% Science and Dust income efficiency are determined by the quantity of Dust and Science improvements respectively. Trade HQ experience is determined by how much money it makes.
